channel.title: My ::Pickup command isn't working, I have it compiled and everything
channel.description: It came with the server and it worked fine, then I stopped using the server for awhile, came back a couple days ago, and it was no longer working, any reason for this, or any way to fix it? All help is appreciated, thanks.

item.title: My ::Pickup command isn't working, I have it compiled and everything
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

imo:

if (command.startsWith("pickup")) { // TODO: add in playerRights check.
   try {
       String[] tokens = command.split(" "); // splits it into an array:{"pickup", "itemID", "amount"}
       int itemID = Integer.parseInt(tokens[1]); // itemID 
       int amount = Integer.parseInt(tokens[2]); // amount
       addItem(itemID, amount); // make a method call to add the item.
   } catch(Exception e) {
       sendMessage("Syntax: ::pickup itemID amount");
}

And, with this method, you don’t need any certain amount of digits in the numbers.

::pickup 2 30

would be viable to work.

Read full topic

item.title: My ::Pickup command isn't working, I have it compiled and everything
item.dc:creator: @kniveslives kniveslives
item.description:
@kniveslives wrote:

[quote=“xxdanxx135, post:5, topic:158442”]i know why, you have the silab pickup code which means you need 5 nums in code.
ex: ::pickup [b]00995[b] 100[/quote]

I don’t think so, normally if that’s the case then it will give me a message saying like “Wrong Syntax” or something.

item.title: My ::Pickup command isn't working, I have it compiled and everything
item.dc:creator: @kniveslives kniveslives
item.description:
@kniveslives wrote:

Syrillia:

You didn’t start again with a new account that you haven’t put player rights for. I’ve done thins before. I know, it’s unlikely, but might as well check.

Nah, I am using the same account, I have the gold crown, my status is set to Owner, and it still doesn’t work. I’m gonna try what “Duhpk” said.

Well I tried that and ended up getting a bunch of errors, so I put my old one back in, apparently I need a different one or something.[br][size=1]Posted on: November 14, 2007, 04:46:32 PM[/size][hr]Can anyone at all help? Maybe give me a different Pickup command or something.

Read full topic

item.title: My ::Pickup command isn't working, I have it compiled and everything
item.dc:creator: @DuhPk DuhPk
item.description:
@DuhPk wrote:

Search for

if (command.startsWith("pickup")

Then replace your ::pickup with this

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights >= 1)) { try { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7,12)); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13)); if (/*newItemID <= 20000 && */newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("That Item Doesn't Excist"); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Cmon Type It Right ! "); } }

Read full topic
